title: Promos
description: The release of the documentary promos creates tension for the Dunder Mifflin employees, Dwight considers a business venture with his girlfriend's family, and Jim and Darryl have an awkward business meeting with baseball player Ryan Howard.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Uh oh. She's doing it again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis has gotten into audio books and lately she's been listening to 50 Shades of Grey.  Which, if you don't know what it is, it's a book about um...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: It's porn.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Phyllis rocks her chair into his provocatively] Seriously. Ugh. Ok, this is unacceptable. It's officially a hostile work environment.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Somebody just needs to get her attention, tell her it's not OK to do this in public.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Be careful. I pulled my mom's dog off a pillow once, and I got bit.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Just ignore her. Sooner or later she'll finish.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Ugh. Ew.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phyllis is masturbating. In the office right now as we speak.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can we skip the color commentary and just have Andy go out there and fire her?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: He- he can't do that.  Turns out she's allowed to have feelings of sexual arousal.  It doesn't become a violation until she physically acts on it.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Toby, how do you propose that we-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait a minute. Why is Phyllis so aroused?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's listening to 50 Shades of Grey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well there you go. That's muy caliente.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, you are useless. I'll take care of this. [walks out of Andy's office and dumps water on Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What the hell?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's OK guys, she's no longer horny.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excuse me, dirty birdie [takes Phyllis' iPod]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You can have this back at the end of the day.  [cut to Andy listening to the iPod and looking aroused, water is dumped on him] Oh!!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Clark, I need your advice. I'm having some lady troubles.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: What's her name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Esther Ruger. [Angela makes a face in the background]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Sweet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lives on the neighboring farm. 85 acres.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh yeah. Keep talkin'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, we've been out three times, there has been physicality but the thing is we were hanging out with her father the other night looking at a farm catalog, next thing I know he wants to lease a tractor with me.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: The same thing that you think.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A long term tractor lease is going to put pressure on a relationship.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: God, one of my buddies is going through the same thing right now. Something in the air.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Here you go. And good for you Dwight, I'm so glad you found someone. I bet she's got kind eyes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight is dating a brussel sprout farmer named Esther.  She's coming here this afternoon with her father.  Who knows? Maybe she'll be pulling the horse cart! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Cici has been calling me 'Pamela'. Like four times this week.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh man. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I wonder if she'll start calling you 'Jim'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh boy, please don't. Let's not let that happen.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] Um.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was I gonna- What was I gonna say?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're- You know your assistant told me that you have a big pitch meeting today. With Ryan Howard. How did that happen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not that Ryan Howard. Um, the Phillies' first baseman.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, oh OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Um, Ok. Well?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. So, uh, I'll uh, talk to you later?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, sounds good. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Meredith laughs] What's going on? Oh, did Gangnam Style put out a new song?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There's a promo for the new documentary on the web.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Play it again.

quotes.speaker: Promo Voice
quotes.text: [Music begins, Michael Scott is shown] The boss. [Pam and Dwight are shown in episodes past] The workers. [Ryan and Michael are shown] The lives. [Jim and Pam and Dwight and Angela are shown] The loves. [More flashback clips] The people. The paper. The Office: An American Workplace. Coming soon on WVIA.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa. You go to the bathroom for 45 minutes and everything changes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This is a documentary? Oh, I always thought we were like specimens in a human zoo.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Angela is rewatching the promo and looks nervous about the part with her and Dwight] Did you see this? [lifts monitor in her direction]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Your screen is all black. You just unplugged your computer.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [Pam smiles as she watches the promo with her and Jim on the roof] Oh my god, is that you and Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Jeez, you fell in love with that hair? Really? [laughs] Yikes. That is awful.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It wasn't so bad.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys, are you reading the online comments? Somebody commented on my banjo playing. "Banjo at 0:19 is aight" Internet, calm down! I must be really connected with this guy.  I mean that's the guy's name, right? ChobbleGobbler?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey man, how you doin'? Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Nice to meet you. Eat Fresh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, man. Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey there, Ryan. Nice to meet you. Eat Fresh. [to camera] Eat Fresh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's go to the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Esther's on her way up. I wonder if she wants a snack. Let's see, I know she likes apples and carrots.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I bet she does.  I bet she'll eat them right out of your hand with those big strong teeth.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did I tell you about her teeth?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey Dwight, you have some guests. I think they're from the forest where we harvest our paper.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah, the Ruger family. Welcome.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ruger
quotes.text: Fine office you have here. Sturdy walls.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Esther, you look radiant as always.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Thank you. [Dwight kisses her forehead]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I guess men find Esther attractive.  I mean if there are chubby chasers, then there are men that like that....thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Weird to see how we used to look in those promos. Some of us have changed so much.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [eating soft pretzel] We've all changed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: With our firm, you'll be building equity for long after they've retired your number.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And we all know, baseball does not last forever.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I look at these actors on TV and I think: "C'mon, I can do that."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Watch this: Eat Fresh. Now what does that make you think of?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Subway sandwiches.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How? I didn't say Subway sandwiches. It's called playing the subtext.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I actually wrote a screenplay, it's called "The Big Piece"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Based on his nickname. Like it already. Let me guess, it's autobiographical.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Half biopic and half superhero movie.  A mild mannered professional baseball player, Ryan Howard-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: -hits a home run into outer space. Ball comes back with space dust on it, which transforms him into: The Big Piece.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The space dust does it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Space dust.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I actually brought a- some copies of my script if you guys wanna read it together.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure, yeah. [laughs] Hollywood. [Ryan Howard pulls out 3 thick scripts] Alright.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Wow. Yeah, we gonna read it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, great.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy, are there documentary groupies?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of course there are!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: A little ironic that I'm going to be kind of a TV star, because my last Chad Flendermen novel [groups groans] was based on a murdered TV star. The small screen-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, I don't care.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey guys, I just found another promo. It's in Danish. I guess it's gonna start airing in Denmark.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Promo Announcer
quotes.text: [Speaks Danish]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What was that word they said when they showed me "Skrald mand"? What's that mean in Danish? Cool guy? [Oscar looks it up]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dumpster Man.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool. Superhero.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What about me? "Klokken tre pige"

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: "Three PM Girl"

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What? Why would they...wait a second, wait a second! What was that? [pauses on her and Dwight leaving the warehouse area where they've just had sex] Oh! I didn't know they were filming then!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It looks like the camera man was hiding behind the shelves.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wait. So they were filming all the time? Even when we didn't know it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh my god. [All look at camera horrified]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: There was much more secret filming than I expected. [laughs] But I am fine with it, I mean it. I am.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you kidding me? It's like half the show is secret footage.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I am a very private person. I show 'em when I wanna show 'em. Who wants a taste? [lifts shirt to flash camera] Boob sauce!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh my god. Do they film us at night when we're sleeping?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, Erin. They film us at night when we're sleeping. Cause that makes great TV!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm sorry sweetie. This whole thing is just freaking me out.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I have been very honest with you guys.  In a way that could seriously impact the political career of a very good friend of mine.  You're not going to use any of that, are you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: People, relax! We are killing it online. Have you guys checked the comments? SmokeThatSkinwagon says: "You guys are killing it!" I mean, we're internet sensations guys!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think we need to figure out what's going on. I might just take a little walk.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yes, a little walk sounds like a good idea. [groups moves to warehouse and you can hear Erin whispering something]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok everyone, turn off your mikes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We need to know more. Did their shots have sound? What exactly did they get on tape?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I sneezed into my hands without using Purell and then dipped into the candy jar.  Did they film that?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: My first week here I sneezed directly into the candy jar because I thought I'd get more [Angela and Oscar make disgusted faces] I thought I'd get more screen time than anyone.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Ok, Pam. Why don't you visit your buddy, the crew guy that got fired? Find out what they got.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Brian?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess I could.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hurry Pam, I need to know how much hellfire is going to rain down on me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I thought Terry knew about Cynthia?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: She does. But neither of them know about Lydia.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Whoa! Whoa! OK, so what's this lever do?

quotes.speaker: Ruger Sister #1
quotes.text: That manipulates the secondary shaft.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh, the secondary shaft. Eeeh, oooga! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Salesmen
quotes.text: The lift capacity's up at two thousand pounds. That's a lot of beets.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ruger
quotes.text: Let's talk terms. If you agree to a forty sixty split on this tractor, I'll store it in one of my barns.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mr. Ruger, are you trying to take advantage of me because I'm interested in your daughter? Fifty fifty split or no deal.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ruger
quotes.text: Esther, get in the truck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok ok ok, wait! You win. [shakes hands]

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: Let's get the paperwork started.

quotes.speaker: Ruger Sister #2
quotes.text: We should buy an auger together.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ruger Sister #1
quotes.text: You would be a great one to buy an auger with.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello, honey? I just spoke to the TV repair man, he says we need to keep our TVs turned off for a couple of months. Something about the wiring.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh! Seven new comments. "The guy at 0:19 is hawt!" [typing] "Hi Bongripper, it's me, Andy. The guy from 0:19, I'm glad that you enjoyed my work in that promo. I really enjoyed your comment, going to read some more comments now. Have a great day!"[reading] "He's not hawt, he's gay." [typing] "Dear JasonJasonJason, it's me, Andy. Nice name. Not! Guess what? I'm not gay! So you are an IDIOT. And I am hawt, according to people on this site who have a brain. Never comment on this page ever again." [reading] "He is hawt!" See, thank you, that's more like it. "He is butt." God dammit! I'm about to lose my FREAKING MIND! Screw you TexasPoonTappa! Uh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Security deposit. That's been-

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ruger
quotes.text: Standard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right, standard.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey, can I talk to you for one second?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: One second.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: One second.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am closing a deal on a tractor with the father of a woman I plan to inseminate.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Don't do it. [takes Dwight's pen]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Don't you cap that pen. Do not cap that pen! Do not! Ugh! You capped it. Wow. You are serious. Ok, you've got two minutes and then the cap comes off.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Dude, we're being conned.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go on.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: These chicks are way too hot to be into us.  Esther's just pretending to like you so that you'll buy her daddy a new tractor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yes. Her sister's trying to seduce me into buying an auger with her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Has the warranty expired on the auger you have now?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I don't even know what an auger is!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No woman would ever want a man who doesn't know what an auger is.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ruger
quotes.text: Hey, you ready to sign?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just need a moment to consider your offer. Excuse me. [grabs Clark]

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Oh, hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Hi. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi, um. I'm sorry, do you have a minute? Is this a bad time?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: No, no, please, yeah, come on in. It's good to see you. Sorry, my place is usually not this-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my gosh, please, don't.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah, no, I- actually it's always like this. [laughs] Do you want to go outside? It's a little less cluttered out there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure, yeah. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Let me grab a couple drinks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. [Goes out onto terrace] Oh wow, you have a nice view.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Alright, that's for you. [hands her beer]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Plays boom box to drown out sound] Alright, how much have you revealed on camera about your relationship with the senator?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: They caught us kissing on Halloween.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh! He was dressed like Ronald Reagan! [Slaps Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: God!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela! Well he kissed like Jack Kennedy!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh! [slaps him again] Stop it! Stop kissing him! Someone needs to call and warn him. This could ruin his career.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, I don't like giving him bad news.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Call him!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You call him!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Call him! [hits Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Stop hitting me!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Call him! Call him!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: So...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So..

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: What brings you by?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, the promo for the documentary aired today.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Oh yeah, that's right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. It's kinda crazy.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah, it is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: See all this like old stuff, like um, there's that shot of Jim and I up on the roof?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Oh yeah, that was, that was a good moment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, wasn't that neat?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah, it was cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, and there's this one when we were listening to music and it's like, it's like w were in love and we didn't even know we were in love and it's...but- Do you think Jim's changed?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Um...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry. Did that? That was out of the blue-

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: No no, it's-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just mean because you know us and you like observed us for ten years and I feel like he's- I just feel like...he's so into his work right now and....I don't know, am I crazy?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: No, you're not crazy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I wish that made me feel better. Listen, so everybody saw the promos and they're kinda freaking out. [Brian laughs] Cause it seems like you got a lot of private stuff on camera-

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, stuff people didn't intend for everyone to see. And they kinda want to know how much.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: They want to know how much what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How much stuff you got.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Pretty much everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well yeah, but what if we turned our mike packs?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: They've got parabolic mikes, they can pick you up a hundred yards away, so...no if you were around there, they got you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So we basically had no privacy for ten years.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: That's not really true, I mean-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um...yeah, I gotta, I gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Oh no, hang on a second. Pam, I'm sorry, I- I- I can explain this so much better.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No I think you explained it.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Look, if you give me a chance I can, I- [Pam leaves] Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Together we will win this baseball game against the evil space Yankees. Eat Fresh."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That'll pay for the exploding helicopter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Smart.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: "Suddenly, the evil thugs break in to the stadium.  The Big Piece hits baseballs at the evil thugs."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Buy me some peanuts and cracker jacks."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Come on man, sell it!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [louder] "Buy me some peanuts and cracker jacks!"

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, that's better. A bunch of hot women go: "Oh yeah!"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Megan, I was too shy to tell you this when I was just a normal professional baseball player, but I love you."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: "They kiss. It is super emotional. Like in Toy Story."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. I tell you what, it's really strong. I can't wait to read the rest of it later and see how it ends.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's so strong.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Keep reading then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Gotta go! Darth Vader's launching a huge attack."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um another thing. I'm gonna need you to get me the rights to Darth Vader.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know how we'd go about doing that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We can look into it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We'll look into it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We need Darth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We gotta get him.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We'll go after Darth then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We're gonna go get him.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's what we gotta do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We're gonna get him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe you're right. Esther's a ten and the best I've ever done is Angela who's a nine and she rejected me.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: A Scranton nine, but yeah, point taken. Hey, let's go out tonight and just score a couple fours huh? I mean there are no games with fours.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who needs a new tractor anyway? Maybe we're the kinda guys who end up with a tractor that's already been rode hard and put away muddy.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Screw new tractors. Guys like us, we gotta plant our seed a different way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: By hand.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Dwight, we need to talk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know that there's anything left for us to talk about, Esther.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Look, we're gonna have the tractor for the same amount of work days but my dad is planning on leasing it to the Vanderkirk brothers on the weekends.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: So you're going to be paying more, but he's putting on ten times the miles and he's pocketing a profit behind your back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That snake!

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: You need to tell him you want a deal based on miles or he can just stick that tractor where the sun don't shine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That shady grove out by Willard's pond.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, you're fine with me not leasing the tractor? I mean, our courtship can proceed?

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Of course. [laughs] You didn't just think I was tractor bait, did you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] No!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey Dwight, what's an auger used for?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Post hole digging. [points and laughs with Esther]

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Stupid.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: [On speakerphone] You've reached Senator Robert Lipton, please leave a message. [beep]

quotes.speaker: {Angela} & {Oscar}
quotes.text: Hi honey!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No you go. Hi honey!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Hey Robert!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's Angela and Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Just a few quick things.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Um the documentary's going to be airing soon, and, and you look great in the promos.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh you look so handsome! Very presidential.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Very much so.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, I get the sense you're gonna be outed as gay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes and I cheated on you with Dwight, it looks like they got it on film. I didn't tell you about it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think that's it!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think we're good.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Done!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Bye!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Love you! [Oscar hangs up] God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on video] Hey! TexasPoonTappa and JasonJasonJason and all the rest of you haters out there! Check this out. [plays banjo, screen types out "you suck my nutz" from TexasPoonTappa, camera zooms out to reveal Nellie]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Good night Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Huh? Yeah, see ya. [sees comment] Oh! What?! [starts crying]

quotes.speaker: Promo Announcer
quotes.text: [Speaks Danish]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I hope you got sound on everything. I'd love a DVD of that. [at computer opens translator. Types in "Elskere" which comes back as "lovers" Pam smiles]
